title: Android Weekly Issue #639
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored Integrate a high-quality doc scanner in your app With Docutain SDK, you integrate fast and reliable document scanning, OCR and data extraction within minutes. Supports Android, iOS, and cross-platform frameworks. Offers ready-to-use UI components. Works 100% offline. Many industry leaders use our Scan technology already. Get a free trial license! Coroutine Testing - Controlling time Kaushik Gopal continues the series, showing how to control virtual time in concurrent logic. Parcelable vs Serializable Amit Shekhar writes about the difference between Parcelable and Serializable and shows how they work internally. Sponsored Break Free from Manual Mobile Testing Manual testing hinders innovation and leaves you vulnerable to costly errors, poor user experiences, and missed opportunities. Join mobile testing experts on September 17th to learn how to empower your team to adopt mobile automation and accelerate release cycles. Register today. Avoiding the Auto-Completion Trap in Android Studio Jaewoong Eum explores how to selectively disable auto-completion suggestions in Android Studio Kotlin KSP — how to automate everything in the world Serhii Hryshyn implements automating navigation descriptions in the Compose Navigation library using KSP. Best Practices for Managing and Resolving Dependency Conflicts in Gradle Harman Khera explores strategies to resolve dependency conflicts in Gradle. How to develop an AI app with a local model in Kotlin Multiplatform Karol Wrótniak shows how to create an AI app using Kotlin Multiplatform and a local AI model, with a technical focus specifically for developers. Creating a Custom Gauge Speedometer in Jetpack Compose Sahil Thakar shows how to build a custom speedometer using the canvas approach. Type safe navigation for Compose. Don Turner covers the stable API and points out changes since the first alpha release of Jetpack Navigation 2.8.0. Google Maps in Jetpack Compose: Getting Started In this new series of blog posts, Joe Birch shares how we can use the different parts of the compose mapping package. Architecture related decisions in Android - The Rest Zsolt Bertalan wraps up his series on how architecture-related decisions can have serious implications. Improve Compose UI with Spacing Constants Donovan LaDuke shares a simple way to enforce spacing design standards when implementing UI with Jetpack Compose. On building a digital assistant for the rest of us - Part 1 This series of articles by Thomas Künneth is about implementing a small digital assistant on Android that uses Gemini 1.5 Pro. Shimmer animations in Jetpack Compose without extra dependencies Mike Yerou shows a simple to implement shimmer animation in Jetpack Compose without adding another dependency to our project. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! News TensorFlow Lite is now LiteRT LiteRT is the new name for TensorFlow Lite (TFLite). Android 15 is released to AOSP Google has released Android 15 and is making the source code available at the Android Open Source Project (AOSP). Our first Spotlight Week: diving into Android 15 The Android 15 "Spotlight Week" will provide resources — blog posts, videos, sample code, and more — all designed to help you prepare your apps and take advantage of the latest features. Videos & Podcasts Android 15 | Spotlight Week Android 15 AOSP dropped earlier today, and Google's kicking off a new series called "Spotlight Weeks"! Build your own compiler with KSP with Alireza Tizfahmfard Alireza Tizfahmfard considers what a compiler is, explains core concepts, introduces Meta-Programming, and shows use-cases of the compiler. Applying the State Pattern in Kotlin Dave Leeds looks at code that could benefit from the State Pattern DON'T Do this Mistake with derivedStateof! Charfaoui Younes teaches about a common pitfall in Compose when using derivedStateOf. Android Studio Ladybug, Compose/Fragment Interop & More Philipp Lackner covers the new Android Studio Ladybug as well as some cool interop changes for Compose and Fragments. Building for the future of Android | Spotlight Week Join Dan and Ash as they dive into building for the future of Android! August 2024: App Hosting, Genkit, Firestore features GA, and more Welcome to the August 2024 edition of Firebase Release Notes. In this video, Marina gives the top 6 updates from Firebase for August! droidcon Berlin 2024 All the presentations from Droidcon Berline 2024

html:
With Docutain SDK, you integrate fast and reliable document scanning, OCR and data extraction within minutes. Supports Android, iOS, and cross-platform frameworks. Offers ready-to-use UI components. Works 100% offline. Many industry leaders use our Scan technology already. Get a free trial license!

Amit Shekhar writes about the difference between Parcelable and Serializable and shows how they work internally.

Manual testing hinders innovation and leaves you vulnerable to costly errors, poor user experiences, and missed opportunities. Join mobile testing experts on September 17th to learn how to empower your team to adopt mobile automation and accelerate release cycles. Register today.
